alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 2:48AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Clay, Harlan, Knott, Knox, Leslie, Letcher and Perry. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Harlan, Pineville, Hindman, Letcher, Bath, Cumberland, Jenkins, Loyall, Fleming-Neon, Vicco, Wallins Creek, Blackey, Big Rock, Leatherwood, Arthur, Big Laurel, Yeaddiss, Big Fork and Pine Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry
